div.p: Online returning registration is open now through May 1.
View our COVID-19 resource page for updates.
District 58 is developing a Master Facility Plan with community input, including feedback from the Citizen Task Force (pictured).
Will your child start kindergarten in fall 2020? View our Kindergarten Resource Guide.
Follow District 58’s progress toward achieving its goals!

font.a: Subscribe to this calendar with iCal.

div.div: Students in grades K-8 will be dismissed at 2 p.m. on Mondays during the 2019-20 school year to provide teachers with professional learning time.

a.span: Select 58 Awards Banquet @ Herrick Middle School

div.div: Students in grades K-8 will be dismissed at 2 p.m. on Mondays during the 2019-20 school year to provide teachers with professional learning time.

h3.a: District 58 school closures extended through the end of the school year

br.span: This means that all school districts will continue with remote learning until the school year concludes.
The District 58 Board of Education held a virtual business meeting on Monday, April 13, 2020 using Zoom and a YouTube livestream. Read meeting highlights.

h3.a: Please take our Remote Learning Survey

br.span: District 58 seeks family input on its remote learning plan and family experiences with it at home.

h3.a: District 58 opens online 2020-21 school year registration for returning students

br.span: Plus, online new student registration will open in late April.

h3.a: Board of Education: April 13 meeting preview

br.span: The District 58 Board of Education will hold a virtual business meeting on Monday, April 13 at 7 p.m.

p.img: The District 58 Communication Guide provides a simple chart outlining District 58’s many communication tools. Learn how and where to access information about District 58!

div.p: Sign up to receive District 58’s award-winning Communicate 58 newsletter!

body.script: function ctctEnableBtn(){ jQuery( "#ctct-submitted" ).attr( "disabled", false ); }function ctctDisableBtn(){ jQuery( "#ctct-submitted" ).attr( "disabled", "disabled" ); }
